required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Interaction Study of Rifampin and Warfarin in Healthy Volunteers.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Rifampin on the Pharmacokinetics of Warfarin in Healthy Volunteers.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the importance of uptake drug transporters in the drug disposition of warfarin. We predict that the elimination of warfarin will be decreased when co-dosed with an inhibitor of uptake drug transporters.

primary_outcome.measure: S- and R- Enantiomers of Warfarin (S-warfarin and R-warfarin) Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From 0 to 12 Hours.
primary_outcome.description: Uptake effects on warfarin pharmacokinetics during time period of hepatic organic anion-transporting polypeptide (OATP) inhibition by rifampin. Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours after warfarin dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity of S-warfarin and R-warfarin
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of all concentration-time data. Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of S-warfarin and R-warfarin
secondary_outcome.description: Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.

intervention.description: warfarin 7.5mg po x 1; rifampin 600mg IV x 1

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All participants were medication free throughout study enrollment

group.title: Warfarin First, Then Warfarin+Rifampin
group.description: In a randomized, single-dose, two-period, crossover design, 5 participants received warfarin alone 7.5mg po; after a minimum of 14 days, participants received a 30-minute IV infusion of 600mg rifampin immediately followed by warfarin 7.5mg po.

group.title: Warfarin+Rifampin First, Then Warfarin Alone
group.description: In a randomized, single-dose, two-period, crossover design, 5 participants received a 30-minute IV infusion of 600mg rifampin immediately followed by warfarin 7.5mg po; after a minimum of 14 days, participants received warfarin alone 7.5mg po.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Includes participants randomized to receive warfarin alone then warfarin+rifampin, and those randomized to receive warfarin+rifampin then warfarin alone in the crossover design

outcome.title: S- and R- Enantiomers of Warfarin (S-warfarin and R-warfarin) Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From 0 to 12 Hours.
outcome.description: Uptake effects on warfarin pharmacokinetics during time period of hepatic organic anion-transporting polypeptide (OATP) inhibition by rifampin. Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours after warfarin dosing.
outcome.population: Each of 10 participants received both treatments separated by a minimum of 14 days; treatment sequence was randomly assigned

group.title: Warfarin Plus Rifampin
group.description: warfarin plus rifampin : warfarin 7.5mg po x 1 immediately following rifampin 600mg IV x 1

measure.title: S- and R- Enantiomers of Warfarin (S-warfarin and R-warfarin) Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From 0 to 12 Hours.
measure.description: Uptake effects on warfarin pharmacokinetics during time period of hepatic organic anion-transporting polypeptide (OATP) inhibition by rifampin. Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours after warfarin dosing.
measure.population: Each of 10 participants received both treatments separated by a minimum of 14 days; treatment sequence was randomly assigned

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity of S-warfarin and R-warfarin
outcome.description: Analysis of all concentration-time data. Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.
outcome.population: Each of 10 participants received both treatments, in randomly assigned order, separated by a minimum of 14 days

group.title: Warfarin Plus Rifampin
group.description: warfarin plus rifampin : warfarin 7.5mg po x 1 immediately following rifampin 600mg IV x 1

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity of S-warfarin and R-warfarin
measure.description: Analysis of all concentration-time data. Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.
measure.population: Each of 10 participants received both treatments, in randomly assigned order, separated by a minimum of 14 days

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of S-warfarin and R-warfarin
outcome.description: Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.
outcome.population: Each of 10 participants received both treatments, in randomly assigned order, separated by a minimum of 14 days

group.title: Warfarin Plus Rifampin
group.description: warfarin plus rifampin : warfarin 7.5mg po x 1 immediately following rifampin 600mg IV x 1

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of S-warfarin and R-warfarin
measure.description: Blood collection 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.
measure.population: Each of 10 participants received both treatments, in randomly assigned order, separated by a minimum of 14 days

reported_events.desc: Each of 10 participants received 2 treatments (warfarin, with or without rifampin), in randomly assigned order, separated by a minimum of 14 days. Participants presented for venous blood collection and were assessed for adverse events at 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours after warfarin dosing.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Each of 10 participants received both study treatments, in randomly assigned sequence, separated by a minimum of 14 days

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
